terms.definition: Application Programming Interface - a set of rules and protocols that allows different software applications to communicate with each other
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted by a provider and accessed via the internet
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to revert to previous versions and track modifications
A lightweight markup language that uses plain text formatting syntax to create structured documents that can be converted to HTML
A private, collaborative website used within an organization to share knowledge, documentation, and information among employees
A support model where customers can find answers and solve problems independently using documentation, FAQs, or knowledge bases without contacting support staff
Step-by-step documentation that explains how to use a product, software, or service, typically written for end users
Search Engine Optimization - the practice of optimizing content and websites to improve their visibility and ranking in search engine results
The process of controlling and assigning user access rights to determine who can view, edit, or manage specific documents or sections of a platform
A centralized support system that handles customer inquiries, technical issues, and service requests through various communication channels
A systematic process where content or documents must be reviewed and approved by designated users before being published or made available
The ability to customize and maintain different brand identities, themes, or appearances within the same platform for different audiences or organizations
JSON Web Tokens - a secure method of transmitting information between parties as a digitally signed token, commonly used for authentication and authorization
A feature that allows multiple users to simultaneously edit the same document with changes appearing instantly for all participants
